meanings.definition: Not relevant or connected to the matter at hand.
meanings.sent1: The color of the walls was irrelative to the discussion.
meanings.sent2: Her favorite ice cream flavor was irrelative to the topic of the meeting.
meanings.sent3: His choice of socks was irrelative, but it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The chirping of birds seemed irrelative to the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies was as irrelative as a snowstorm in summer.

meanings.definition: Lacking a meaningful or significant relationship.
meanings.sent1: The random numbers on the page seemed irrelative to the calculations.
meanings.sent2: Her sudden outburst was irrelative to the calm atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meowing was irrelative, but it added a touch of humor.
meanings.sent4: The old clock ticking away seemed irrelative to the modern world outside.
meanings.sent5: The distant sound of a train was as irrelative as a fish in a tree.
